segments.text: I notice the girl standing there with her hand out, waiting for a cookie like it’s the most natural thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She looks so innocent, but she’s clearly in on the plan with her brother.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but smile at how determined they both are, even with the stool wobbling like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is still drying dishes, completely unaware of the cookie heist happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’d be angry or just laugh if she caught them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is still overflowing, and she hasn’t even flinched.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like she’s in her own little bubble, and nothing else exists.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a little bad for her, though, because she’s going to have a big mess to clean up later.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But for now, the kids are winning, and I can’t help but root for them a little.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just hope they don’t fall and ruin their victory.
segments.speaker: PAR
